description: Apartment (Fenway), 1BR, 1250, Hi there!I am looking for a female roommate for my 2 bedroom,  1 bath Fenway apartment. The apartment is on the fourth floor of a professionally managed apartment building a block from Boylston street in the heart of all that Fenway has to offer! The building houses mostly working professionals and is in a very safe neighborhood. Move-in date is September 1.Your bedroom has two windows,  can fit a full or a queen size bed,  dressers/nightstand,  and a desk. It comes with a fairly deep closet with space for overhead storage inside. In addition,  we have a hallway closet that you will be able to use for additional storage. The rent is $1, 300,  not including utilities,  which on average is an additional $50-70 a month. To move in,  you would need first and last month's rent (as a refundable security deposit).There's a washer/dryer in the basement. The apartment has a proper living room,  and is already furnished with some common furniture (couches,  kitchen table,  chairs) that you're more than welcome to use. If you have a lot of furniture yourself,  we'd need to figure it out as there may not be enough space.I have lived in the apartment for 2.5 years and although my lease ends in Feb 2017,  I will most likely extend it for next year. The best thing about the apartment is the location. There are a whole bunch of restaurants within a block or two. Star Market and the Fenway Target are two blocks away. Public transport is super convenient -- Fenway T station (the green D line) is a 7 minute walk from the apartment,  and the 55 bus that loops through Back Bay/Copley/Downtown stops right at our block.A bit about myself -- I am a 24 year old female working in management consulting in the Copley area. I tend to travel quite a bit for work so you may have the apartment to yourself for part of the week. When I am working locally,  my schedule is pretty variable,  so I may be gone 9 to 6 or later,  or may be working from home for the day. I am very low-key especially during the week/around the apartment. I may have a few friends over once in a while but you'll always be informed beforehand and would be welcome to join us!I do have a very chilled out 6-year old cat named Turtle that I adopted a year ago. Hopefully you love animals/cats,  would treat him like your own pet,  and are okay with feeding him if I am out of town.A good match would be a female in her twenties with a stable job/income. We don't need to be best friends ,  but it's great to come home to a friendly face who is up for cooking together or grabbing a drink once in a while.Respond to this post via email with a little bit about yourself,  a phone number,  and when you're looking to move in and we can take it from there! The roommate who's moving out will be responding first to figure out if it's a good fit.P.S. the pictures are from when the previous tenant lived here -- I'll be happy to send you more recent ones once we have had a chance to talk.

description: ), 2BR, 750, Hello!We are a queer couple,  both women in our 30's,  who are looking for a roommate to share our lovely two bedroom apartment starting September 1st!About the apartment:The apartment is conveniently located in Jamaica Plain within a 10 minute walking distance between Stony Brook and Green Street stations. The street itself is quiet,  and the other tenants who live in the building are as well. The apartment itself is quite spacious,  with a big living and dining room area. It also includes a sizable kitchen,  washer and dryer in unit,  a shared office space,  and a front and back porch. There are two bedrooms. The one we occupy is a bit larger since we both live in that space. The second one (which we are currently renting out) is also comfortably sized,  with lots of closet space and room for a full-sized bed and a couple other pieces of furniture.There is plenty of space in the apartment for any furniture you might want to bring. There is also a basement,  but as far as we know,  tenants are not allowed to store anything down there other than a bicycle. That may be negotiable with the landlord however,  who is extremely friendly and quick to respond should we need him for something.About us:We both have full-time jobs and tend not to be home during the weekdays. We have relatively active social lives and are likely to go out from time to time,  as well as have friends over occasionally (but not obnoxiously often). When at home,  we like to spend time cooking,  watching Netflix,  playing video games or hanging out having a glass of wine on the porch. One of us works in the public health field at MGH,  runs marathons,  likes to do crafty things and is extroverted. The other is both a baker/cook,  a freelance digital artist,  and a musician who likes to play video games and is somewhat shy.What kind of roommate we are looking for:Mainly,  we are looking for someone who has an easy-going nature,  is responsible and,  of course,  clean. Since we are in our thirties,  we are hoping to find someone who isn't in the 'party stage' of their lives and is more settled down (although we are definitely not opposed to the occasional party and tend to have some ourselves from time to time). Ideally,  we would also prefer a queer person or at least someone who is very comfortable and accepting of the queer community.As far as pets go,  there is a friendly 10 year old cat who lives here. She is very sweet,  but unfortunately gets too anxious around other animals so we cannot accept any more pets.We also are looking for a single roommate to move in. No couples please (although your partner is of course welcome to stay over and spend time here within reason).The move in date is September 1st and will require first,  last and security deposit. Early move-in (8/30 or 8/31) is possible.If you are interested and send an inquiry,  please let us know a bit about yourself. Nothing too long,  but comparable to our own description of ourselves above. Thanks and we hope to hear from you!

This stunning residence offers four levels of living space. The first floor is an open concept,  and features a cozy living room with a working gas fireplace and custom plantation shutters,  a gleaming granite/stainless steel kitchen with an island for dining,  and a half bath. The second floor includes two bedrooms and one full bath. A luxurious master suite with a walk-in closet and a four piece bath is featured on the third floor. The finished basement has a family room,  laundry,  and storage. The exterior amenities consist of a beautiful enclosed yard with a private patio for grilling and abundant room for gardening,  a spacious front facing farmer's porch,  and an assigned parking spot in the common,  detached,  garage.Locationally,  it doesn't get much better than having the Gran Gusto Trattoria restaurant just across the street. A short stroll across gorgeous Danehy Park puts you right in the middle of things. Whole Foods,  Trader Joes,  Starbucks,  CVS,  all the shops of the Fresh Pond Mall,  and the Alewife Red Line T Station are just across the park.Available for an August 1st 2016 move-in date.Don't miss out on this fabulous Cambridge residence.Brett Neumeistershow contact infoPoint PlusPictures used in our marketing may occasionally be of model units. description: + BDR JP Walk to Forest Hill T W/D - NO FEE!! (Jamaica Plain), 4BR, 4200, This two level 4+ bedroom unit is the 2nd and 3rd floor of an owner occupied two family home on a quiet dead end street in Jamaica Plain,  with easy minute walk to Forest Hills T Station & 5 minute walk to the Arboretum for nature and dog lovers. Lots of great places to eat and drink too!Hardwood floors are gleaming ,  beautiful natural woodwork and detail throughout,  and a fresh new paint color palette has been chosen and designed to give it a modern but classic touch that will go with any d�cor,  making it lovely new place to call home!The kitchen is brand new with top of the line LG stainless steel and has been designed to make any cook happy,  with all the amenities and then some! convection oven,  dishwasher , disposal,  new counters and of course a French door fridge with four people in mind so no worries about food space here! A lot of thought was put into making a comfortable living space,  designed to suit the unit size.The large living room and dining room are perfect for relaxing in or sharing meals with friends,  and have plenty of natural sunlight!Two levels give more than enough room for 4 like minded people to spread out in. The layout is flexible,  with extra space for a smaller living area upstairs (should you choose to set it up that way),  or possibly an office downstairs. (It has been used as a 5 bedroom as well,  so that is an option but we would need to discuss further if interested in adding more people).There is one full bathroom which is contemporary and full size (with tub),  there is a new,  super efficient LG laundry in the unit,  and there is a back porch off the kitchen that is a very peaceful place to relax.Pets (with responsible owners and manners) are ALWAYS welcome here!Gas utilities are included (heat & hot water)Parking is on street only (with permit).First,  last & PARTIAL security required.Please feel free to email me with any other questions or to set up a time to see the unit.
